metadata.Title: CVE-2018-8034 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - low.
metadata.Description:
The host name verification when using TLS with the WebSocket client was missing. It is now enabled by default. Versions Affected: Apache Tomcat 9.0.0.M1 to 9.0.9, 8.5.0 to 8.5.31, 8.0.0.RC1 to 8.0.52, and 7.0.35 to 7.0.88.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-8034` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libservlet3.1-java - 8.0.32-1ubuntu1.7
libtomcat8-java - 8.0.32-1ubuntu1.7
tomcat8 - 8.0.32-1ubuntu1.7
tomcat8-admin - 8.0.32-1ubuntu1.7
tomcat8-common - 8.0.32-1ubuntu1.7
tomcat8-examples - 8.0.32-1ubuntu1.7
tomcat8-user - 8.0.32-1ubuntu1.7
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: tomcat7 package in esm-apps/xenial is affected and needs fixing.
tomcat8 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '8.0.32-1ubuntu1.7').
